svg:
>
>
>
>
E-waste Recycling Technologies and Processes
>
E-waste Recycling Process Flow
>
Collection & >Transportation >
Sorting & >Disassembly >
Material >Separation >
Material >Recovery >
Refining & >Purification >
New Product >Manufacturing >
Recovery Rates >• Metals: 80-95% >• Plastics: 50-70% >• Precious metals: 85-98% >
>
Collection and Sorting
>
Collection Methods
>
Drop-off centers >
Take-back programs >
Retailer collection >
Curbside pickup >
Sorting Criteria
> By device type >By material content >By age/condition >By hazardous content >By brand/model >By recycling method >
Quality Assessment > • Functionality testing >• Reuse potential evaluation >• Data security clearance >
>
Disassembly Technologies
>
Manual Disassembly
>
Hand tools
>
Screwdrivers >
> • Component identification >• Selective removal >• Hazardous material handling >
Automated Disassembly
>
Robotic systems >
• Vision systems >• AI-guided processes >• Higher throughput >
>
Material Separation
>
Physical Separation
>
Magnetic separation >Iron, steel removal >
Eddy current >Non-ferrous metals >
Density separation >Heavy/light materials >
Air classification >Plastics from organics >
>Sieving/screening >Size-based sorting >
>
Material Recovery Technologies
>
Mechanical Processing
>
>Shredding >Size reduction >Liberation of materials >
Crushing >Brittle materials >Glass, ceramics >
Milling >Fine particle generation >Powder production >
>Granulation >Plastic processing >Uniform sizing >
>
Chemical Processing
>
H+ >Acid leaching >Metal extraction >HCl, H2SO4, HNO3 >
OH- >Base treatment >Neutralization >NaOH, NH3 >
Solvent extraction >Organic solvents >Selective dissolution >
>Precipitation >Metal recovery >pH adjustment >
>
Thermal Processing Technologies
>
Pyrometallurgical Processes
>
>Smelting >1200-1600C >Metal extraction >
>Incineration >800-1100C >Energy recovery >
>Gasification >600-900C >Syngas production >
>Plasma treatment >5000-10000C >Complete dissociation >
Thermal Processing
>Advantages: >• High recovery efficiency >• Volume reduction >• Energy recovery possible
>Disadvantages: >• High energy consumption >• Emissions control needed >• Capital intensive >
>
Advanced Recycling Technologies
>
Biotechnology Applications
>
Bioleaching >Bacteria-assisted extraction >Thiobacillus, Acidithiobacillus >
Biosorption >Biomass binding >Algae, fungi, bacteria >
Emerging Technologies >• Supercritical fluid extraction >• Ionic liquid processing >• Electrochemical recovery >• Microwave-assisted extraction >
>
Process Optimization and Economics
>
Optimization Factors
> Recovery Efficiency: >• Material purity: >95% >• Process yield: >90% >• Energy efficiency: <5 MJ/kg >
Economic Viability: >• Processing cost: $200-800/ton >• Material value: $1000-5000/ton >• ROI: 15-25% for viable plants >
>
